headline: Sorry Europe, American Luxury Brands Are In
summary: The best investment in the luxury goods industry over the past five years wasn’t one of the usual suspects such as  Hermès  Instead, Coach owner  Tapestry  is the surprise leader, with  Ralph Lauren  a runner-up.  Shares in Ralph Lauren and Tapestry have gained 29% and 55%, respectively, this year, on top of total shareholder returns of more than 60% in 2024.  Not bad for brands that are sometimes considered the poor cousins to pricier and more established European luxury names.
